intro: Hermione cypri, commonly known as the Cyprus bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms from late spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
